intro: Wendlandia sericea, commonly known as the silverleaf bellflower, is a striking perennial plant native to South America. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
